subject: JUnit FAQ TestSetup example
msgSnippet: Dear Junit users and developers, I am afraid that I did not understand the example with the heading of HOW do I run setup code once for all of my TestCases?
messageBody:
Dear Junit users and developers,

I am afraid that I did not understand the example with the heading of
"HOW do I run setup code once for all of my TestCases?"

http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm

Here's my code:

import junit.framework.*;
import junit.extensions.TestSetup;

public class TestEverything extends TestCase {
public TestEverything(String testName) {
super(testName);
}


public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(new TestMsgQueue("testConstructor"));
suite.addTest(new TestMsgQueue("testPutAndRemove"));
suite.addTest(new TestMsgQueue("testPutMsgContentAndGetMsgContent"));
suite.addTest(new TestMsgSender("testSend"));
TestSetup wrapper = new TestSetup(suite) {
public void setUp () {
oneTimeSetUp();
}
};
return wrapper;
}
public static void main(String[] args) {
String[] testCaseName = {TestEverything.class.getName()};
junit.textui.TestRunner.main(testCaseName);
// public class TestAgent extends TestCase { }
}
}

.... when I compile, the compiler complains about the method

oneTimeSetup(). So I assume that I need to write my own oneTimeSetup()

method.

Could someone suggest what a oneTimeSetup() method would look like?

TIA

James
